intro: Strophanthus scaber, commonly known as the rough-stemmed strophanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Strophanthus scaber is often found in shrublands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and cardiac glycosides.
